revised_title: The Decomposition of Formates by Bacillus Coli Communis: A Study of Non-Gas-Producing Organisms
tldr: The author investigates the decomposition of formates by Bacillus coli communis and discovers that artificially selected strains can lose the ability to decompose formic acid. This study suggests that examining an organism's behavior towards formic acid can help determine if it has been recently derived from a gas-producing strain.
